title: Part A (i) Comprehension
stimulusHtml:
Select a point value to view scoring criteria and examples or to score the response.

Responses that earn this point display an accurate and complete comprehension of what serious personal crisis Pliny describes in the passage.
descriptions:
The response does not display adequate comprehension of the passage or relevant part of it.

Question A (i): Identify what serious personal crisis Pliny describes in this passage.

Examples that earn this point include but are not limited to the following:

  • “He gets sick”

  • “Pliny’s life is in danger because of an illness”

Responses that do not earn this point.

  • Restate the prompt.

  • Display an inaccurate comprehension.

  • Display an incomplete comprehension.

The response displays an adequate comprehension of the passage or relevant part of it.

Question A (i): Identify what serious personal crisis Pliny describes in this passage.

Examples that earn this point include but are not limited to the following:

  • “He gets sick”

  • “Pliny’s life is in danger because of an illness”

Additional Notes:

  • In order for a response to earn this point, it must refer to illness or bad health.

title: Part A (ii) Provide Latin
stimulusHtml:
Select a point value to view scoring criteria and examples or to score the response.

Responses that earn this point provide Latin that fully and accurately supports the answer to Part A (i).
descriptions:
The response does not provide Latin that adequately supports the answer to Part A (i).

Examples that earn this point include but are not limited to the following:

  • gravissima valetudine

  • ad periculum vitae vexatus

Responses that do not earn this point.

  • Provide no Latin.

  • Provide Latin that does not support the answer to Part A (i).

  • Provide Latin that partially supports the answer to Part A (i).

The response provides Latin that adequately supports the answer to Part A (i).

Examples that earn this point include but are not limited to the following:

  • gravissima valetudine

  • ad periculum vitae vexatus

title: Part A (iii) Translation
stimulusHtml:
Select a point value to view scoring criteria and examples or to score the response.

Responses that earn this point provide an accurate and complete translation of the answer to Part A (ii).
descriptions:
The response does not provide an accurate translation of the provided Latin.

Examples that earn this point include but are not limited to the following:

  • “by an illness”

  • “when I was bothered with a sickness”

Responses that do not earn this point.

  • Provide no translation.

  • Provide an inaccurate translation of the answer to Part A (ii).

  • Provide an incomplete translation of the answer to Part A (ii).

The response provides an accurate translation of the provided Latin.

Examples that earn this point include but are not limited to the following:

  • “by an illness”

  • “when I was bothered with a sickness”

Additional Notes:

  • Responses must correctly translate all required words to earn the point.

  • If additional Latin is provided for Part A (ii), the accuracy of the translation of this additional Latin does not affect the response’s score.

  • Responses can still earn the point for correctly translating the Latin in Part A (ii) even if the answer to Part A (ii) did not receive credit.

  • “Illness” or “sickness” is not sufficient for a response to receive credit because it has not translated the ablative case of valetudine.
